verses.verse: Then answered <WH6030> Eliphaz <WH464> the Temanite <WH8489>, and said <WH559>,
Can a man <WH1397> be profitable <WH5532> unto God <WH410>? Surely <WH3588> he that is wise <WH7919> is profitable unto himself <WH5532>.
Is it any pleasure <WH2656> to the Almighty <WH7706>, that thou art righteous <WH6663>? Or is it gain <WH1215> to him <WH1870>, that thou makest thy ways perfect <WH8552>?
Is it for thy fear <WH3374> of him that he reproveth <WH3198> thee <WH935>, That he entereth with thee into judgment <WH4941>?
Is not thy wickedness <WH7451> great <WH7227>? Neither is there any end <WH7093> to thine iniquities <WH5771>.
For thou hast taken pledges <WH2254> of thy brother <WH251> for nought <WH2600>, And stripped <WH6584> the naked <WH6174> of their clothing <WH899>.
Thou hast not given water <WH4325> to the weary <WH5889> to drink <WH8248>, And thou hast withholden <WH4513> bread <WH3899> from the hungry <WH7457>.
But as for the mighty <WH2220> man <WH376>, he had the earth <WH776>; And the honorable man <WH5375>, he dwelt in it <WH3427>.
Thou hast sent <WH7971> widows <WH490> away empty <WH7387>, And the arms <WH2220> of the fatherless <WH3490> have been broken <WH1792>.
Therefore snares <WH6341> are round about <WH5439> thee <WH6597>, And sudden fear <WH6343> troubleth thee <WH926>,
Or darkness <WH2822>, so that thou canst not see <WH7200>, And abundance <WH8229> of waters <WH4325> cover thee <WH3680>.
Is not God <WH433> in the height <WH1363> of heaven <WH8064>? And behold <WH7200> the height <WH7218> of the stars <WH3556>, how high they are <WH7311>!
And thou sayest <WH559>, What doth God <WH410> know <WH3045>? Can he judge <WH8199> through the thick darkness <WH6205>?
Thick clouds <WH5645> are a covering <WH5643> to him <WH7200>, so that he seeth not <WH1980>; And he walketh on the vault <WH2329> of heaven <WH8064>.
Wilt thou keep <WH8104> the old <WH5769> way <WH734> Which wicked <WH205> men <WH4962> have trodden <WH1869>?
Who were snatched away <WH7059> before their time <WH6256>, Whose foundation <WH3247> was poured <WH3332> out as a stream <WH5104>,
Who said <WH559> unto God <WH410>, Depart <WH5493> from us <WH7706>; And, What can the Almighty do for us <WH6466>?
Yet he filled <WH4390> their houses <WH1004> with good <WH2896> things <WH6098>: But the counsel of the wicked <WH7563> is far from me <WH7368>.
The righteous <WH6662> see <WH7200> it <WH8055>, and are glad; And the innocent <WH5355> laugh them to scorn <WH3932>,
Saying <WH518>, Surely they that did rise up against <WH7009> us are cut off <WH3582>, And the remnant <WH3499> of them the fire <WH784> hath consumed <WH398>.
Acquaint <WH5532> now thyself with him <WH7999>, and be at peace: Thereby good <WH2896> shall come unto thee <WH935>.
Receive <WH3947>, I pray thee <WH8451>, the law from his mouth <WH6310>, And lay up <WH7760> his words <WH561> in thy heart <WH3824>.
If thou return <WH7725> to the Almighty <WH7706>, thou shalt be built up <WH1129>, If thou put away <WH7368> unrighteousness <WH5766> far <WH7368> from thy tents <WH168>.
And lay <WH7896> thou thy treasure <WH1220> in <WH5921> the dust <WH6083>, And the gold of Ophir <WH211> among the stones <WH6697> of the brooks <WH5158>;
And the Almighty <WH7706> will be thy treasure <WH1220>, And precious <WH8443> silver unto thee <WH3701>.
For then shalt thou delight <WH6026> thyself in the Almighty <WH7706>, And shalt lift up <WH5375> thy face <WH6440> unto God <WH433>.
Thou shalt make thy prayer <WH6279> unto him <WH8085>, and he will hear thee <WH7999>; And thou shalt pay thy vows <WH5088>.
Thou shalt also decree <WH1504> a thing <WH562>, and it shall be established <WH6965> unto thee <WH216>; And light shall shine <WH5050> upon thy ways <WH1870>.
When they cast thee down <WH8213>, thou shalt say <WH559>, There is lifting up <WH1466>; And the humble <WH7807> person <WH5869> he will save <WH3467>.
He will deliver <WH4422> even him <WH336> that is not innocent <WH5355>: Yea <WH4422>, he shall be delivered through the cleanness <WH1252> of thy hands <WH3709>.
